bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WILSON of South Carolina:H.R. 2571.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1 Section 8[Page H3501]

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

National Right-to-Work Act

This bill repeals those provisions of the National Labor Relations Act of 1938 and the Railway Labor Act that permit employers, pursuant to a collective bargaining agreement that is a union security agreement, to require employees to join a union as a condition of employment (including provisions permitting railroad carriers to require, pursuant to such an agreement, payroll deduction of union dues or fees as a condition of employment).
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: National Right-to-Work Act

item.title: To preserve and protect the free choice of individual employees to form, join, or assist labor organizations, or to refrain from such activities.

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: National Right-to-Work Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
